headline: Rampant AI Demand for Memory Is Fueling a Growing Chip Crisis
summary: Since the start of 2026, Tesla Inc., Apple Inc. and a dozen other major corporations have signaled that the shortage of DRAM, or dynamic random access memory — the fundamental building block of almost all technology — will constrain production.  Cook warned it will compress iPhone margins.  Micron Technology Inc. called the bottleneck “unprecedented.”

summary: Micron Technology (NasdaqGS:MU) has started high volume production of its next generation HBM4 memory chips a quarter earlier than planned. Micron is positioning itself as a key memory supplier for AI infrastructure as Samsung moves closer to certifying its own HBM4 for Nvidia GPUs. Micron is best known for DRAM and NAND, but HBM4 puts it directly at the center of AI data center builds, where memory...
